characters: INT. COMMUNITY CENTER MEETING ROOM. LATER.
--FOUR SEXY BRAZILIAN DRUMMERS AND FOUR GORGEOUS BRAZILIA
INT. UKRAINIAN MUSEUM DINING HALL. NIGHT. LATER.
EXT. FORK IN THE ROAD. DAWN.
AN ELEPHANT, WITH TWO TINY PLASTIC ASTRONAUTS SITTING ON
A MULTI-TIERED WEDDING CAKE, WEDGEWOOD BLUE, IN THE SHAPE
CARNIVAL GIRLS COMPLETE WITH HEADDRESSES AND FEATHERS DAN
EXT. BUCHMAN BACKYARD/OUTSIDE THE TENT. DUSK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KYM, a darkly beautiful girl in her early 20's, is smokin furiously on the porch of an URBAN HALFWAY HOUSE. She gla impatiently at her watch and presses her ear to her cell phone. As she exhales, WE HEAR the rumble of thunder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irritated, she crams her cell phone into her bag. ROSA a halfway house staff nurse is patiently handling WALTER, an irate patient who is screeching...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want my fucking Zippo now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter starts yanking at his hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter, that is a behavior...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (raking his nails against his forearm) Fuck you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you are making a choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her cell phone rings...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Walter) Hold on...Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you get it yet, Waldo? She's making a choice not to give you your lighter because you'll torch the Self-Help library again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Walter. Kill anybody recently? Run anybody over with a fucking car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym grinds her cigarette under her heel and blows smoke b gives no signal that she's heard anything. She yanks her phone out of her bag as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tan Mercedes STATION WAGON pulls up in front of the Hou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kym) That them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Finally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosa takes two of Kym's several bags. They are oddly matc A Coach tote, a fake Prada, a Gristedes bag, and a World Wildlife Fund tote bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not letting her get behind the wheel are you? Are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter, you are only responsible for yourself. (To Kym) This is all your stuff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know you never gave me your cell number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto) It was a mistake. I'm lucky I didn't get fired. We've discussed this. (She offers her hand) Good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym doesn't appear to have heard her but she shakes the h barely... so very, very faintly. Kym's dad, PAUL BUCHMAN, a tired, prosperous man in his l 50's steps around the car and trots up the porch steps. H wearing a big smile and his glasses are foggy. They hug. talks rapidly over his shoulder...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god. Here you are. I thought you were going to abandon me in rehab. It's 12:30. You guys are half an hour late. I've been standing here with these lunatics. You look so great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul offers his hand to Rosa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. I'm Paul Buchman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Rosa. We met last time you came up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (doesn't remember) Of course, of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go, let's go. Where is everybody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAROL, a handsome woman in her 40's, waves from the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loudly) Hey Carol. How are ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Kym.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where's Rachel? Carol, where's Rachel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym slides into the back seat as Paul loads the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Getting everything ready at the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is so much going on at the house I can't tell you. You know your sister's doing all of it herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyeing the rearview mirror as she arranges her bangs) My sister is bending the environment to her will? Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No wedding planners or anything like that. Just her and Sidney and a lot of their friends. She is so thrilled you're here. Is that everything, sweetheart?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distractedly, rifling through her bag) Yah. Can we go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there anyone you want to say goodbye to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The station wagon travels through a constantly changing series of environments as they journey out of New York Ci on their drive to suburban Connecticut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right away though, Kym lights up a cigarette and Paul and Carol crank their windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So are all these busy young wedding helpers staying at the house? Because after eight months of constantly revolving cell mates and crazy people...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You weren't in a cell, Kym...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...AND groups groups GROUPS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...And nobody was crazy, nobody was in a rubber room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I was looking forward to a little privacy for once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only extra person staying at the house is Emma, who's actually been staying in your old room. But she can move, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel and Emma. Oh, great. How relaxing.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: KYM (cont'd) The only two people on the planet less capable of delegating than Hannibal! On the eve of a wedding! Nachtmare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nachtmare?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a nightmare so bad it's in German.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel must be totally freaking out. Is she too tense?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a wigwam!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (right on top of him, rifling through her bag again) ...Is she eating? Or are all her latent food issues rearing their heads? Is she hoarding Snickers and Cool Whip under the bed like in high school? She never did put that one to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (genuine) I don't think that that's a problem for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No offense, Dad, but you never thought that was a problem for her. I'm kidding. It'll be great to see her. Foodies are the worst, though. They never get it together. There were six of them on my floor in the hospital and you could never get into the bathroom. They would cry at the chocolate pudding and one of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: them was a guy. I can't wait to see Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll see her and Andrew at the                     rehearsal dinner tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we stop at the 7/11 please? I                    feel nauseous. I need something to drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I brought you a Diet Coke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She offers the can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I prefer Pepsi from the fountain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol looks at Paul. He is fiddling with the dashboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym fills her Big Gulp at the fountain and pays at the counter. The COUNTER GIRL gives her change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw you on COPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym appears not to have heard. She pockets her change and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Paul drives through a bucolic, well-to-do neighborhood featuring a beautiful old church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The station wagon pulls into a CIRCULAR DRIVEWAY lined wi trees and bushes of beautiful blue hydrangea. There are several late model cars parked in the driveway of the SPRAWLING, SHINGLED HOUSE. Young people crawling everywhe in the midst of WEDDING PREPARATION, wrapping garlands an hanging paper lanterns. A LITTLE GIRL tosses rose petals the swimming pool. The atmosphere is slightly punch drunk friendly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul unloads Kym's bags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do it, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym charges into the house where NORMAN SKLEAR and more friends of Rachel are decorating. They stare at her as sh runs up the stairs to the second floor. CAMERA RUNS ALL T WAY UP WITH HER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we raise this hem half an inch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah. Here, let me just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym slams open the master bedroom door and finds her olde sister, RACHEL, trying on her wedding dress with the help her best friend EMMA. Radiant and sexy, Rachel glows like angel in her creamy white and gold sari. Emma has pins in mouth and a tape measure around her neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god, you are just mi-nute!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kymmie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kym) You can't smoke in here--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel and Kym squeal and embrace. Rachel is slightly awk as Emma frantically tries to keep the billowing fabric fr combustion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have pins all over me. You look great!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fat. Rehab makes you fat. All the vending machines. Look at you, missy! I'd swear to god you were puking again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma! (To Rachel) No seriously, you're so tiny it's like you're Asian. Dad wants us to sleep in the same room so you'll be able to watch me while he's asleep and I won't sneak out of the house and blow dealers and shoot heroin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad did not say "blow dealers."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told him I'd just sleep in Ethan's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can always shoot up in the tree house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym laughs. A little too loud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym, I'm not remotely surprised you're starting your drama already, however it's Rachel's wedding and this week it's about her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma, you still have your tiny core of rage! What a relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym flops on the bed and gazes adoringly at her sister fo moment. Rachel beams back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So are you an actual shrink yet? Even though you're like twelve years old?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Psychology. Not psychiatry. You know the difference, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should prescribe something soothing for Emma. Like Vicodin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will have my PhD. in a year and a half. And psychologists don't get prescription pads, right Kym?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They do in Guam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you please put that out? Emma designed this dress and there's forty-seven yards of it and I'll go up like the Hindenburg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym takes a last drag even though she's down to the filte then flushes the butt down the toilet in the tiny bathroo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over the flushing toilet) Since when are you a designer, Emma?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has this great little boutique in Greenwich. She says things like "you need a fabulous jersey pant."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's so great. I think I heard that. Isn't this your fifth incarnation or something? Weren't you an actress? All the N.E.D.'s in the hospital were actresses...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: N.E.D.s?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Non-specified Eating Disorder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...they were constantly doing leg lifts under the sheets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angela Paylin is coming to the wedding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (right on top of her) I ate so much cookie dough and did so many whip-its with Angela Paylin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. And she confessed to you her secret Elvis Stoyko fantasy. I spied on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elvis Stoyko the figure skater?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In her fantasy, she was wearing her hair up and very serious, responsible eyeglasses, because she was a world renowned judge at the Winter Olympics for Men's Figure Skating. And Elvis Stoyko was skating in the finals to "Could It Be Magic" for the gold medal. And just when Barry Manilow is singing "Now/ Now/ Now and hold on fast..." there's this electric connection between them and he stops in the middle of his triple lutz...axel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he skates over to the judges table, all panting and sweaty, with his spangly Neil Diamond shirt open to the chest...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is silence as he stops in front of her, their eyes lock, and he reaches for her hand... and Angela takes it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the roar of the crowd and the shock of the Olympic judges!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: KYM (cont'd) And he pulls her out of her chair, undoes her hair, and they skate as a pair to the rest of the song!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he gets disqualified but he doesn't care!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd she get the skates from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They collapse in laughter. Kym studies her ass in the mir

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should call her right this second. Is she really coming? Who are all these energetic young people decorating the house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's got everyone she knows pulling elf duty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (squinting at her ass) What about me? What am I doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel and Emma exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I think you'll be assisting on floral detail. I want everything all drippy and luxurious and Mom's a little bit tasteful--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Mom's in charge of flowers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --and I don't want to upset her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kym) And you're such a diplomat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am. I'm like Kofi Annan. In rehab they said I was the maternal hub of my peer group. I was always the referee for softball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel snorts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was. I was the only one who could convince the methamphetamine freaks that no one was chasing them when they ran around the bases.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's softball. Someone was chasing them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever. They have trust issues in the first place. I'm going downstairs to find Olive and get some unconditional love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym swans out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, I'm doing some lighting. I already got the candles and everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel and Emma share a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget Mom and me and the fucking flowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym crosses the hall to ETHAN'S ROOM and opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speaking of dawgs, when am I going to meet this fiancee of yours anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He went to get stuff with Kieran. They'll be back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little boy's bedroom. Pale blue. A single bed, a window some games. Some stuff in boxes. Not a mausoleum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym enters Ethan's room. She stands there looking around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes a moment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym wandering the upstairs hallway...the winding corridor are a little spooky, despite the openness and light, it f haunted up here...looking into her old bedroom, seeing Em stuff inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul comes to the bottom of the stairs, yelling up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAUL I'm making hot dogs and hungabungas! Who wants what?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel and Emma shout back down. RACHEL It's too hot! EMMA I don't eat gluten, Paul! PAUL What don't you eat?! EMMA Gluten!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAUL Where's Kym?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym appears, down the back stairway, behind Paul, not shouting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KYM Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL Besides I'm in my dress!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooo! Can I see?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul starts up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul has stopped half way up the stairs. He turns to Kym, beams at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kymmie, what can I make you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually there's a meeting I have to make. And I have to pee in a cup. And register as a general biohazard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll drive you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (heading downstairs) Just tell me which car I should take.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul doesn't say anything. Carol floats to Paul's side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you do me a favor, Kymmie...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a license...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wouldn't believe my insurance. And I'm not... that comfortable. Could we figure something else out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym pedaling up on a bouncy, high tech racing bike that i far too big for her. She bangs herself in the crotch as s dismounts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KYM Hello? Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym stops a baby-faced NURSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KYM Hi. I'm here to pee in a cup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NURSE (over her shoulder) She needs to pee in a cup. (back to Kym) Someone will be right with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KYM Okay. I'm trying to get to a meeting. NURSE The meetings are over in the other building. KYM I know that. NURSE Someone will be right with you. Have a seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several people are waiting in chairs. They look at Kym.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DIFFERENT NURSE is waiting by the sinks examining her t in the mirror. Kym bangs open the door of her stall with foot. The door swings back and Kym spills her sample all herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KYM Piss!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she runs up the OUTSIDE STAIRCASE Kym wipes at her shi with a wet paper towel. She yanks open the door and a bir poops on her. KYM Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Narcotics Anonymous Meeting. Chairs, light. An ATTRACTIVE is sharing. Kym slams in, frazzled and late. A few people look at her as she grabs a folding chair from a stack lea against the wall and the other chairs slide to the floor a huge clatter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KYM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ATTRACTIVE GUY Only once. My dealer. I was really broke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room breaks up. Kym struggles to rearrange the fallen chairs. She is pissed. ATTRACTIVE GUY Let's see...that was Tuesday...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PASTOR MEL, a guest speaker, shares details of his strugg inside the "12 Step" Process. Kym, like everyone present, riveted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweaty and fed up with Carol's bike, Kym cycles into the Buchman driveway. Paul has been watching for her out the kitchen window while doing dishes. He waves and yells to wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAUL Carol, she's here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KYM Where did you think I was?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAUL I made you a sandwich, sweetheart! Meatloaf!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym's shoulders slump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watching from an upstairs window, Rachel observes Kym whe the bike up the driveway and Paul hurrying from the kitch to meet her, carrying a meat loaf sandwich and a glass of milk. There is an awkward exchange of items. Paul hugs an mushes Kym and kisses her on the forehead. Rachel opens the window, calls down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kymberly!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fiancee SIDNEY, sexy, compact, thirties, and best man KIE are stringing lights all over the house and yard. Kieran on a ladder. He is the same ATTRACTIVE GUY from the meeti Sidney is completely wrapped, chest to knees, in twinkly white lights and he unspools himself as needed. Rachel arrives with Kym who is holding the aircraft carrier size meatloaf sandwich that's oozing lettuce and ketchup and t enormous glass of milk. She holds them both like they're suspended in formaldehyde. Emma is working on her tan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL No. You guys are not getting my design concept. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: RACHEL (cont'd) I want every single light to represent a different one night stand during the misspent youth of Kris Kringle before he stopped whoring around and became Santa Claus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. I thought you said Satan Claus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought she said Panty Hose. Or Panda Claws.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pandas are endangered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. We're having an endangered Panda fleeing for its life for the ice sculpture. Or impaling itself on some bamboo. Kym! This is Sidney Williams, my betrothed. Sidney, meet my sister, Kym.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god. You're black. (To Rachel) Sorry I called him a dawg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No biggie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't look like a record producer. You're supposed to have a hapless lackey next to you with an umbrella.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Usually I do, but Mom's out simonizing my car. Funny, you don't look like Lucifer's Cupbearer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fingering a lock of hair) I got a haircut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym gives Emma a look. Emma smiles sweetly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel gestures up the ladder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this is Best Man Kieran.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym looks up the ladder at Kieran.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym and Kieran, having SEX in the cavernous basement. It runs practically the length of the house and there are no and caves everywhere. An ancient sofa, riddled with cigarette burns, some futons, dragged down and thrown haphazardly in corners, Unicorn posters hideously and pornographically defaced, and squat jars of ancient house products (Oil of Olay, self tanner) filled with cigarette butts offer proof of years of inhabitation. LATER -- Kym lights up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that was so wrong --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee, thanks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, believe me, that was so lovely, LOVELY! But in the program -- as you know -- and we just heard earlier today in fact --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is kind of lurid, isn't it? The best man and the maid of honor... furtively slipping off to the coal bin to have it off while the rest of the wedding party labors away at preparations for the big event.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought...isn't Emma going to be playing that role?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Maid of Honor"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I heard that was the plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LAVISH BOLLYWOOD SOUNDTRACK PLAYS as Emma wraps Kym in lilac fabric for her sari-esque bridesmaid's dress. Kym examines herself in the mirrors of the private salon. The girls look like jewels against the lush fabrics, pillows curtains. Rachel sits at a vanity trying on dangling earr and shakes her head gently, the gems glimmer and sparkle. RACHEL Isn't the lilac fabulous? You look like a freesia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KYM (to Rachel) I love the grey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EMMA We're all wearing lilac. KYM (heedless, grabbing the grey fabric) Look at this. I love this. It's like a cloud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma looks at Rachel. KYM You guys know how I am. I never wear lilac. EMMA It's good to have a principle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym ignores her. RACHEL You wore a lilac sweater with a cat face on it on the cover of Seventeen Magazine when I was at Fat Camp. KYM Sure, but I got paid for that and I was on horse tranquilizers. So why aren't I the Maid of Honor? Why is Emma the Maid of Honor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't entirely sure when you were coming or even if you'd make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym looks sharply at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't sure if you'd have time for a fitting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit. It's a sari. You take a bolt of cloth and wrap it around you. Jesus Christ I've been home one day and I can't get a straight answer out of anybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm talking about Dad offering me food every ten seconds...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad offers Irish Hunger Strikers food every ten seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. He has to know where I am and what I'm doing all the time because he has never resolved his own trust issues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's odd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blow me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, leave Dad alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd love to but he won't let me. I feel him watching me all the time. And Carol and you guys too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know I have nothing better to think about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody's looking at me like I'm the visiting sociopath. What are you people waiting for me to do? Burn the house down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both look at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was a mattress fire and it wasn't even at home! It was on a sleep over! God! I should just get HAZMAT tattooed on my forehead for you people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop! You're like a harpy. Is being my "Maid of Honor" this important to you? I didn't think you gave a shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could you fucking say that to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. Emma!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma, would you be horribly offended and hurt if I asked you to step down as... (exaggerated, practically with quote fingers) ..."Maid of Honor?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Emma's got another reason to hate me. Like she needed one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it what you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For an instant, conflict and pain flicker over Rachel's s face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. The crown is yours, First Runner Up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Emma. No, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's about sisterhood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hooray for sisterhood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sisterhood conquers all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And bludgeons all and pillages all and leaves all for dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (returning to mirror) So the gray is not an option?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE REHEARSAL DINNER --"The rehearsal" component is in fu swing amidst elegant dioramas and displays of Ukrainian f art saints, traditional costumes, a skillion painted eggs the mounted heads of indigenous Ukrainian animals, and th plaster busts of Ukrainian Popes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The audience of revelers is clustered at one end of the r with drinks and appetizers, while at the other end, vario friends take their shot at a brief rehearsal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old friend Norman Sklear is emceeing the line-up -- he is currently at the mike with a funny improv based on really disastrous weddings he has known. Everybody is laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, Carol, a few of Paul's closest record biz friends (including a CULT LUMINARY or two); MR. AND MRS. WILLIAMS (Sidney's mom and dad), sister KAYRA, grandmother HERREAS and cousin JOSEPH GONZALES (in US Army dress uniform, hom leave from Iraq) blend easily with the younger crowd. Cou Joseph is always filming with his own CAMCORDER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QUICK CUTS -- other rehearsal moments such as a TEENAGED GUITAR/DRUMS DUO blowing out "Here Comes The Bride"; Gaid Arabic wedding song; UKRAINIAN AL (the in-house music director) getting the women to chant "Rachel" and the men chant "Sidney" ancient European-stylee; ZAFER TEE's exquisitely heartbreaking improvised violin solo; DORIAN LOVEJOY's Rachel/Sidney FREESTYLE RAP, etc. delivering to breathtaking saxophone solo entitled "Sidney loves Rachel (the real) DONALD HARRISON JR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harrison's toast to Paul, his beautiful family, and the memory of many memorable nights of music in the Buchman h while the kids were growing up draws HUGE APPLAUSE, POWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE DINNER-- The forty-odd guests are now seated in an adjoining room at LONG TABLES laden with a GORGEOUS INDIA FEAST. Yellow rice, red curry, vivid green and orange vegetable dishes, pink shrimp. Huge plates of Dosa and Brinjal. Candles flicker in lanterns shaped like lotuses. PHOTOGENICALLY STYLISH YOUNG SERVERS dressed elegantly in black and white hover around the family and friends as everybody makes total pigs of themselves. The INDIAN FEAST contrasts agreeably with the Ukrainian visuals. EVOCATIVE BOLLYWOOD MUSIC PROVIDES THE SOUNDTRAC Kym, wandering on along the table like a nomad, wedges herself between Sidney and Rachel. Emma grabs an empty wi glass before Kym knocks it over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know anybody at what's obviously the loser end of the table. Can I have your Chana Masala?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without waiting for a response, Kym dives in with her naa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've known most of those people since the eighth grade. You always pretend you don't know people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it because you owe them money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Mom? Where's our mother? How could she not be here already? I haven't even seen her since I've been home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She called a few times. She's "running a little late but should be here soon."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stuffing naan in her mouth) GOD!!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tries to catch a piece of Fish Tikka in her mouth and misses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kieran would you like some more Saag Paneer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks. Is there any krill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma blinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just kidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe Mom would be late for my release back into the wild.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And here I was thinking tonight was about Rachel!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rach, I forgot to tell you, Carol got the helium tanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The words "Carol" and "helium" somehow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't there some rules about helium tanks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snorting) She wouldn't have any idea what to do with a helium tank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only on public property. I think. K?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huge liability.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a lawyer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was. For about five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say something legal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do you do now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I help Sidney out with the business side of his stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls clamber up. Kym brushes curry off Rachel's shir ABBY, the girl's mom, and ANDREW, her husband, enter the dining room. Abby is a beautiful, wise woman in her fifti Elegant, ladylike and graceful. Andrew looks foxy in his Abby-selected Armani, but he has shoulders and knuckles of a heavyweight. As the girls approach, Abby acknowledges Paul across the room but make move to go beyond an exchange of long distance little wav and tight smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Rachel, embracing) Hello, darling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A big hug. She turns to Kym.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym! Did you get my note?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They embrace. Abby steps back but keeps her hands on Kym' shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fat. Rehab makes you fat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nonsense. You girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiya Kym. You look great! Hey Rachel!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses Kym on the cheek. Rachel gives him a big hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, where have you been? Is everything okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. We were wondering if you got the dates scrambled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby steps towards her daughters, taking them in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, everything is absolutely fine now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank god. What a relief! Now the party can really get started.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby and Rachel look quickly at Kym.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lighting a cigarette) So Mom, you look great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darling, can you smoke that in here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a private party, Mom. How's grandma? Still surly and irascible?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you know how she is. She sends her love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. Same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym drags on her cigarette like it's the last Coca Cola i the desert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, you should really put that out. It's not right. You know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: INT. UKRAINIAN MUSEUM DINING HALL. NIGHT. LATER.
dialogues.text: Kieran is making a toast. Dinner is mostly over. Waiters discreetly clearing plates, etc. from the table, pouring drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (something like) I've known Sidney most of my life. He personifies many of life's grandest cliches, even as he breathes fresh life into most of them. He has never, ever "ceased to amaze me," and only in the best of ways. The magnitude of his artistry and his business acumen are matters of public record and delight. He's been a great friend "through thick and thin," and sometimes it's gotten very, very thin -- but he "stood by me" at all times, so it is my privilege and honor to stand by him on this profound occasion...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIME CUT -- Emma rises and bangs her glass with her spoon shatters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're paying for that, Emma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. I'd like to make a toast to the happy couple because I want to come visit them in Hawaii.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: EMMA (cont'd) Sidney what's the name of that place again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Humuu-humuu Nukku-nukuu...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A-Pu-Aa-Aa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney kisses Kieran on the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sharply, to her sister) You're moving to Hawaii?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney's recording studio is there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym, stung, exhales a plume of smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've known the bride her entire life. Not biblically, except for that one time we french kissed at Evan Yassky's party in the ninth grade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Film! I want film!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoops and hollers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commence embarrassing story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That wasn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rach, do you remember the time I was teaching you to drive in the Wagoneer and you sideswiped that taxi driver and knocked off his side mirror?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no memory of that whatsoever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you remember trying to outrun him and leading him on a high speed chase across 96th street?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta say no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I would like to share with everyone that Miss Rachel-before she got her license or even had any idea how to drive- out maneuvered an irate, screaming cab driver across 96th street to the East river, handily avoiding two EMT guys loading an old lady on a gurney, while at the same time, applying Cocofudge Lip Gloss in the rearview mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bravos all around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, wait. She actually got the number of one of the E.M.T guys and went out with him. Twice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loudly) Was that the guy with the peroxide hair?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby, not looking at her daughter, shushes her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, when the taxi driver finally caught up with us, Rachel talked him down from his Middle Eastern fury in pretend Farsi, and ended up using his radio thing to call his dispatcher and recommend this guy for a commendation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mahamoud! Such a nice man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were driving so fast! It was one of the more exhilarating moments in my life...sadly...but I knew that Miss Rachel would make it okay. So here's to you, my dear, dear friend. A woman who can drive fast, pick up a paramedic, make up languages and get you home in one piece. Sidney, you are a lucky bastard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hear hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where? Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby smiles broadly at Rachel and blows her a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym rises with her glass and takes Emma's place on stage. glows in the candlelight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (for the crowd) Relax, it's seltzer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Low giggles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. I'm Shiva the destroyer and your harbinger of doom for the evening. I want to thank you all for coming and welcome you even though I haven't seen most of you since my latest stretch in the Big House...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scattered low giggles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all look fabulous. During the twenty minutes I was not in the hole for making a shiv out of my toothbrush, I actually did participate in the infamous 12 Step program. 12 Steps. Step-ball- change, step-ball-change. I'm still waiting for the change part.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some guests laugh. Sidney grins. Carol, Paul, Rachel, and Abby sit silently. Andrew moves in towards his wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But as they say, relapse is an almost always inevitable component of recovery, God knows I've got high marks in that mode!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is staring at Kym.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyhoo, as more of you know than are likely to admit, one of the actual steps is about making amends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I spent a lot of time calling up people who barely remembered me - who barely remembered anything - and apologizing to them for bouncing a check or passing out in the bathtub and flooding their house, or otherwise involving them in sordid activities they were desperately trying to forget. I had to call this one girl who was, I think, fourteen, but I couldn't talk to her because her Mom took out a restraining order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym thinks this is hysterical. Paul does not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, I did a lot of apologizing to people who were practically strangers so I very much want to take this opportunity to not only congratulate my extraordinary sister, the future explorer in matters of the mind, thank you very much, and her adorable, impending husband on the occasion of their unprecedented nuptials.. but also to apologize to my extraordinary sister, the future explorer in matters of the mind, for... Everything! And I really mean that, Rachel. I've been a nightmare and you've been a saint. I'm so damned glad I'm here with you and Sidney and his family and ours, and I am so happy for you guys, I really am. So, I am hereby raising my seltzer in celebration of my laudatory sister and herewith making amends. Sidney, you are robbing our dysfunctional family of one of it's most vital ingredients, and it's only member still willing to lend me money. (She pauses for a second) Enjoy Hawaii. La Chaim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lifts her glass and downs it's contents. There is a smattering of applause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the group) One down. What's for dessert?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kieran stares sympathetically at Kym.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guests leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym drops into a chair in the dining room as Paul, Carol, Rachel, Sidney, Kieran, and Emma struggle in with several elaborately wrapped wedding gifts and leftovers from the rehearsal dinner, which they pile on the dining room tabl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel and Sidney are having a quiet, tense exchange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to anyone, examining her split ends) I'm exhausted. Is there any watermelon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Kym, as if she's joking) Nice apology.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (again, making a joke out of it) Nice apology.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was toasting you and I was making amends. It's one of the Steps. It's important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what the Steps are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel glides to the den and drags out the huge dictionar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I learned them in school, and I've visited you in various facilities, Kym.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney and Emma share a look. Rachel drops the dictionary on the dining room table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, god. Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym looks to her father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol returns with a tray and a huge watermelon that's be impaled with an enormous kitchen knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amends. Noun. Often followed by 'for'. Offset a disability or frustration by development in another direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel blinks at her sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exaggerated) Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've never said anything to me, that's remotely apologetic. Yet, all of a sudden, at my wedding dinner, in front of everybody, you decide to grace us all with your development?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ. I just got here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol hands Kym a slice of watermelon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. Anybody else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Hey everybody! And guests! Just in case you might be thinking about something else for five minutes, like, I don't know, my sister's wedding-- they just cut me loose!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: RACHEL (cont'd) I'm a loose cannon, is that hysterical? Anyone for some rehab humor? Because I'm really fine with acknowledging my disease. And now watch me be really selfless, and weave a lovely blanket apology to my sister for being a tad out of her loop."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel giggles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney and Kieran, staying out of this, exchange a glance

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chewing) You're so cynical. Dad, since when has she been this cynical?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's making an effort, Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An effort. That's what it was? Because I think she presumes that since everything has always revolved around her disease, everything else is going to revolve around her recovery. That's what I think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel. She just got home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had no idea you were so angry, doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kymmie, your sister's got a lot on her plate. She's uptight about...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not uptight, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's meeting Sidney's folks for the first time, there's menus, there's all that live music, you're home, there's a thousand things to worry about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely, a wedding will take it right out of you, boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it would be so lovely if we could all just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (removing seeds) You people need to purge. You people really should go to Nar-Anon or something. I mean it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my lord. Kym, we have gone through Nar-Anon, baby. You know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning her head) You people? You mean the people in this room? Your family?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of you people living in this little world of judgement and paranoia and mistrust. I can feel it every second. At the slightest sign of ingratitude or absence of atonement it's like the freaking Salem Witch Trials around here. I might as well be...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pouncing) Don't even start...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (standing next to her husband) Nobody can make you feel any way unless you let them, Kym.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you Carol, for your inevitable pearl of wisdom, but you people are my family. You people make me feel like shit a hundred times a day. You try living under Dad's constant monitoring for five minutes and see how you like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What constant monitoring?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "I'll drive you!" "Carol, she's back!" "Don't sleep here, sleep there." "Here. Eat this." Dad, you're obsessed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. That's hardly news. You may not know this...sure you do...the only way to engage Dad in any meaningful communication is to start the conversation with your name. "Have you heard from Kym? How's Kym?" It resuscitates him. It jars him into the moment. Like an alarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's unfair, Rachel. And completely untrue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she's even worse! "Dad, you're never going to believe this, but I lost the car again." "Dad, you're never going to believe this, but that check you sent me never showed up and my landlord hates me." "Dad, can somebody meet me downstairs with cab fare and you're never going to believe this but I need to go to the emergency room and my neighbor's suing me and my checkbook got stolen!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee, Rach, sounds like you have some paternal/sibling issues to work through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding? The two of you are like a double helix of crises. In the language of psychology one could say you both suffer from acute boundary issues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel! It's nice that you're getting your Ph.D--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (she throws up her hands.) --Oh god--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --but don't be patronizing. It's ugly. It doesn't become you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come she gets to spout off about paternal issues, but god forbid I should even reference the "boundary thing," even though I actually know what I'm talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waving her arms) Hello? By the way? I'm not in crisis. I haven't been in crisis for a year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just got out of rehab!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is this so difficult for you people to understand? It's like you're not happy unless I'm in some kind of desperate situation. You have no idea what to do with me unless I'm desperate. God. Why am I the only one who's willing to say this stuff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, poor you. You're so much more evolved in your suffering. You know what? Your suffering is not the most important thing in the world to everybody!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: RACHEL (cont'd) There are billions and billions and billions of people, in nations all over the world, who never even think about you! Other people have lives! We have lives! I have a life! I'm in school. I'm getting married. I'm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel just stands there, not saying anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead silence. Everyone stares at Rachel. Rachel looks at Sidney. Sidney passes the look right back to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat, then: HUGE WHOOPS AND HOLLERS!!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations! Oh my god! Etc!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul hugs Rachel and kisses her hair. Sidney and Kieran h Emma hugs Rachel and kisses Sidney. Hugging all around. K is pissed. Paul grabs Kym and Rachel, and hugs both daugh at once. Rachel and Kym's faces are mushed right next to other. Kym is impatient and stiff in the dreaded double m

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym breaks from Paul's vice-like grip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is so unfair!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ecstatic) When did you find out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roughly about the day before we decided to get married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can barely believe it myself!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing, mushing Rachel's belly)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: PAUL (cont'd) How long? How much pregnant? Did you tell your mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We told her at dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was so happy--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! Stop! You can't just drop that tectonic bit of information into a completely separate conversation, Rachel. You can't do that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym, you're going to have a niece!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or a nephew!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, god. Of course I'm happy for you. But you can't tell me when we're talking like this. It's a total set-up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. All the energy drains out of Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am so fucking exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, will you tell her I'm happy for her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just...I need to go to bed. Sidney?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, okay. Great idea. I'm beat too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Rachel) You're leaving? In the middle of this conversation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kymmie, she's pregnant. She's exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. Fair enough. I'm off to raid the medicine cabinet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not serious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone gathers around Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Rachel darling, and Sidney, I couldn't be happier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wasn't serious, was she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do either of you want anything? A sandwich? You must be hungry. There's cold Saagwala and a little Aloo Gobi left over?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks, Dad. I really am pretty sleepy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're pretty everything!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He mushes her face and kisses her cheek. Then he mushes Carol's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy cow. What a day. I think I've aged. I mean it. (To Paul) ) Would you mind if I went to bed, darling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (kissing her again) Of course not. I'll be up, Carol. I'm just going to load the dishwasher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney intones the opening bars to Paul's heroic "DISHWAS THEME". Paul raises the Cautionary Finger in Sidney's direction. Sidney stops with the music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me help, it'll be quicker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now the Cautionary Finger is levelled at Carol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't mess with the King.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay,okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hands in the air, Carol leaves the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. That's it for me too, you guys. Good night everybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kieran lays a manly, buddy hug on Sidney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, my friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kieran leaves. Now it's just Rachel, Paul and Sidney. Pau beaming like a klieg light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never been so tired in my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul gives Rachel a kiss on the cheek and mushes her face some more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sweetheart?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope it's okay, I told Mom at dinner. About the baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, lamb chop. I'm so happy! I'm going to be a grandpa!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney mushes Paul and they attempt a hug and laugh and t they really hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish Ethan were here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, sweetheart. Me too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That went well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kieran and Kym lie entangled in the basement, sharing a cigarette, disheveled. The floor of this entire section o the basement is now covered with all of the carefully arranged mattresses and futons that were stacked down her before. All of Kym's mismatched bags have been moved down here too. There's a little lamp there now as well but it' not on. Only one of the small, cobwebby windows casts a dappled light onto the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was such a set-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She probably didn't realize she was doing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha! She's such an operator. Now I'm the bad guy again. Or still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're lucky to have you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you! Otherwise they'd have to pay attention to their own suspicious lives. Nobody actually wants me to actually change, you know. What would they obsess about? I'm like a blessing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) No argument from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad had an actual "Blueprint for Rehabilitative Success" at my last intervention. On graph paper. He goes all out with the response, my dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not unlike this great nation in which we live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile an ex-heterosexual ex-boy friend of mine actually rang the door once and tells my mother, "Kym is sitting in her apartment? With the shades drawn? Doing all this heroin and cocaine? And I think she's going to, like, die?" And Mom smiles and says "Thank you" like he was speaking in Sanskrit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't actually speak in Sanskrit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly! I nodded out into the poached salmon at Dad's wedding two years ago and he told Carol he thought it was jet lag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did that in soup once. It made such a mess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saturday morning. A giant delivery truck drives slowly up driveway, delivering the tent for tomorrow's wedding part

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym leads Kieran through the labyrinthine rooms of the basement giving Kieran a guided tour of the subterranean world of which she was the ruler and where Ethan was her loyal companion -- the secret hide-and-seek rooms, the mattress room, the scary little side rooms, etc...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A very stylish, very elegant, very "modern" (in the best sense) home, lots of grounds, lots of foliage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel and Abby are seated on Abby's bed, looking through some family heirlooms in an old alligator jewel case. Rac is holding an ornate satin evening purse. RACHEL Look how exquisite this is. I can't borrow this. What do you carry in here? A vital organ? A tiny spleen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABBY Isn't it divine? It was grandma's. She sends her love. RACHEL I love the color. It's oyster. ABBY You must promise me you'll stay healthy now, Rachel. You'll eat properly and get a lot of rest?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Mom. ABBY How are things going at the house? How's Sidney?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABBY And his friend? What's his name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kieran.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABBY He seems to be a big hit. Is your sister behaving herself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not exactly sure what that means.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, she needs a lot of acknowledgement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop. It can't be easy. Everybody knowing her troubles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, she's sold syndication rights to her troubles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, does it bother you at all, Carol doing so much wedding stuff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at all, darling, I'm thrilled to be providing the flowers. You know how much that means to me. They're going to be exquisite!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I'm sure, and that's so great and so you, but you can do whatever else you want, you know. I'd love it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, my sweetheart. I just know I'd be one of those wedding mothers who goes completely insane about the hors d'oeuvres. Andrew says I shouldn't be allowed near a shrimp puff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are so many other people for you to worry about.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ABBY (cont'd) Your sister's home and everybody's there and the bride always ends up keeping everybody else satisfied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But this is going to be the most beautiful wedding ever. And I hope your sister has a wonderful time too...Anyway I'm going to be a grandmother! Hooray!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hooray!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so excited. I have always wanted to be a grandmother. Even when I was thirty. Here. This ring was grandma's and she wanted you to have it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's beautiful. Thanks, Mom. I hope it's a boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As long as it's healthy. Try the ring on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've always had the most beautiful hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A neighborhood place, but on the other side of the parkwa from the Buchmans' neighborhood. Friendly, bustling, kids bikes and skateboards, etc. Large windows offer a view of stop sign, Fanny's Beauty Salon, Soul to Soul Liquor, a barber shop, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The restaurant is fluorescently lit, with a Jamaican flag the wall and photos of Muhammad Ali, Malcolm X, and Bob Marley. There is a counter at the front where you place y order and pick up your food. There is a Foosball table, a pinball machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym and Kieran are playing Foosball at the ancient table where someone has painted Jamaican jerseys on all the players. They are both viciously competitive and genuinel irritated with each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your hand is on the turf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What turf?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The turf. The table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we have to do it over now. It was your shot and you get to do it over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me you didn't know having one hand on the turf makes the play null.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Null. Maybe we should just play Pinball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C/U. The metal balls ricocheting around the interior of t machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes playing next to each other is easier than playing together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who told you that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mom. She runs a pre-school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both crack up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's Hawaii like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've never been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh uh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's beautiful. I've got a nice place. My horse lives there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most people say "my girlfriend lives there" or "my wife lives there."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I live there and so does my horse. He's very possessive. We're working through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you had him a long time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I may be a degenerate dope fiend but I love my horse. I don't have a wife or a girlfriend and I've been clean almost seven years. You could just ask, you know. Your sister doesn't ask direct questions either. She's incredibly cryptic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a shrink thing, not a genetic thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym is sharing at today's "12 Step" meeting. Kieran, the others, listen intently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were in the park. I was sixteen and I was...I had taken all these Percoset. I was unbelievably high.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: KYM (cont'd) He had thrown away his shoes- and I was like "Mom's going to kill me" because I had no idea where his shoes were- but he was so happy about it. And he had his red socks and he was running around kicking up the leaves. You know in movies where they show a person's high or whatever and the camera careens all around? It was like that. But fun. You know. We were having so much fun. We were leaping around in huge piles of leaves. He buried me. I buried him in a big pile. I was on baby sitting detail. He was pretending he was a train. So he was charging through the leaf pile, making tracks, you know? I was the caboose. And he kept going "Coal, caboose! Coal caboose!" So it's time to go and we're driving home and he's in his car seat still demanding coal, and I couldn't focus and I drove off the bridge. The car went into the lake. I couldn't get him out of his car seat. He drowned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, Rachel, Emma, Sidney, and Norman Sklear are sprawle the porch eating sandwiches and figuring out the seating arrangement for the wedding by manipulating tiny origami chickens, a tiny turtle, Monopoly pieces, spools of threa etc...each with a small name tag. Paul sees Kieran's rental pull up, grins, and calls to Carol...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol, they're back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol emerges with a tray of lemonade as the rental is rolling to a stop. Kieran and Kym are climbing out of the car...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting from the porch) Are you hungry? I made a Salad Nicoise. It's got Tuna!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting back) I was just thinking Salad Nicoise!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we get back to what we were doing, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. Where were we? Ah yes...The Rosenzwiegs. Can you please put the Rosenzwiegs somewhere far away from me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul sits heavily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're your friends, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not my friends. I've just known them my entire life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just so you know, my mother expects to be carried in by liveried servants to the triumphant swirls of the harp and seated on a solid gold throne forged by nuns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Because right now I have her shoveling kelp in the laundry room. But I have it as a montage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kieran and Kym arrive on the porch. Kym settles herself o big comfy chaise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you putting me? In the stockade?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym, stop it. You're at the family table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym turns her face to the sun, shutting her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (heedless) Don't put me with Michael and Sandy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not invited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandy never called me back after I sent her an amends e-mail from Milestones. I hate it when people don't meet you half way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The family table. With us.

dialogues.speaker: SEATING PLACEMENT BOARD--
dialogues.text: Paul moves Kym's "marker" -- the MONOPOLY DOG -- to the family table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oops. That's nine. I thought you were having tables of eight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointedly) I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to anyone, her eyes still closed) Where are you putting me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was thinking of putting you with Cookie Puss and the Chicago cousins because they always get really drunk and need wrangling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can someone else do it? I was planning on enjoying myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the only one they're afraid of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still? God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel pushes the MONOPOLY DOG to a different table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not getting it) We can move Grandma Rose and her companion. That's actually a great idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym opens one eye and sees Paul switch markers -- the MONOPOLY DOG is back at the FAMILY TABLE. Rachel stares a her father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all I need. Another reason for Grandma Rose to hate me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't hate you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's still mad about that thing at the Rite Aid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nonsense!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel moves the Monopoly Dog to another table. Paul look her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, can I show you something in the kitchen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul and Rachel alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto) Rachel, what is this behavior?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (same) I would just like to have a day please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have all the days you want. Nobody is taking your day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why are you defending her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Defending her from what? Darling, look, no one's defending any body...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you protecting her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want her to feel like we don't want her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes I don't want her. It's my fucking wedding, don't you get it? I want my table to be perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul kisses her on the forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it. She's your sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other. The screen door swings open as Emma, Carol, Sidney, Kiera and Norman Sklear carry the lunch plates to the kitchen. follows, carrying the salt shaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Dishes? I'm going to load the dishwasher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul! Paul, listen, I've been thinking about it. I did some preliminary sketches, I'd love to show them to you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Carol) He's not kidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I think if you move the salad bowls to the upper tier you can get about 10% more stuff in the dishwasher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hee hee hee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul gives him a look. Sidney starts humming PAUL'S DISHWASHER THEME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney, you're a nice young man. You make a lot of money and the world is your oyster. But you don't know shit about loading a dishwasher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, with all due respect, the mantle has passed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul takes a moment to size Sidney up then spins on his h to the dishwasher.

dialogues.speaker: TIME CUT--
dialogues.text: Sidney has his sleeves up and starts to load.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the time limit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you comfortable with that, sir? I could spot you thirty seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You young people should all go fuck yourselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see Paul, I think your problem lies in lid placement.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SIDNEY (cont'd) Inverting the lids and stacking them in the upper level is really for amateurs. It's passe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel, you're out of the will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Observe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a flourish, Sidney presents a beautifully stacked dishwasher. Paul pats his shoulder somberly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clean out this machine please, boy. So I can break out the whup-ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screaming all around. Kym jumps up and down with her arms Rachel's shoulders. Rachel glances at her sister, laughin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (delightedly) He's breakin' out the whup ass!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul is loading the dishwasher like a champ. Carol and Emma are smiling and giggling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kieran has his eye on the clock. Sidney trash talks from the sidelines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know one of the early signs of senile dementia is an obsessive need to organize.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel, go fetch me my dart gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I find it touching but ultimately sad when the warriors of yesteryear are reluctant to lay down their plastic containers from Zabar's and retire gracefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kieran, how's my time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have twenty-five seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need more dishes. You amateur!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? No way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody give me some dishes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym yanks open a cupboard and passes a handful of dishes Paul. He begins to load them.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: He has a bowl in his hands. We see the bowl is a plastic child's bowl with Engines and Cabooses all over it. Paul turns the bowl around in his hands like a steering wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
