dialogues.text: It dawns on Kym that she's handed her father Ethan's bowl She is stricken. Paul looks to Carol. He seems bewildered. The kitchen fal silent and Carol takes Ethan's bowl and places it in the sink, out of sight. She leads Paul gently out of the kitc

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL --
dialogues.text: She turns and leaves the kitchen. Sidney follows her. Emm and Norman Sklear step out onto the porch. Kieran takes the Ethan bowl from the sink and puts it qui back in the cupboard and shuts the door. Kym doesn't know what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The station wagon heading away from the Buchman house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel is driving, Kym is in the passenger seat. The radi on and neither says anything. Kym cranks down the window, tries to light a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KYM Mom is handling the flowers? RACHEL Well, she's growing them and choosing them - but they are being delivered by her people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KYM Got it. Wow. Nurturing and growing things from the soil. Textbook, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL Kym. Can we talk about the candles for a minute? Because --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KYM Yeah, exactly! Candles and rice paper -- all lit up during the ceremony. It's a way of honoring Ethan, Ethan's... spirit, you know? It will look really nice too, mainly. Millions of little candles all over the place, and one huge rice paper candle - representing Ethan - glowing near the couple. That would be you and Sidney. RACHEL Oh my god, no. Don't. Just don't. That would kill Dad. And Mom. And me. And everybody. Please, Kym, please please please don't do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KYM Geez. It was an IDEA. Lighten up, okay? They do that in Japan or India or someplace, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL Just drop it, sweetie, okay? Please? KYM Oh my god - fine! Done! It was nothing, okay. It was just an idea. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: KYM (cont'd) Just a stupid idea. I was joking, you jerk! Lighten up, Rachel. This is your big weekend. Everything's fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing this busy Connecticut city as the station wa drives behind a fancy hair salon on the main drag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym and Rachel have foils in their hair, situated a few chairs apart. Rachel is intently working on a crossword puzzle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you getting a manicure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel silently waggles her fingers. Kym glances back at her magazine to discover one of the stylists standing close by, gazing at her face. Kym does a little double-take.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't remember me, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym looks sharply at the stylist, noting his sincere face the warmth of his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nooooo.....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick James' limousine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. My. God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel, nearby, grimaces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I meant to come back. I swear. I even had...Oh god, what was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peanut M&M's and Carbona cleaning fluid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God is punishing me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, he's blessing me. It's cool: I talked him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (uncomfortable) So, how are ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm okay. You remember we were in the hospital together, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were...at Milestones?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I didn't go to Milestones. I didn't have the coverage. We were on the same floor at Loeb House. That was before you went to Milestones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you go after that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My parents' house. Unemployment. It's all about the coverage, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares deeply, movingly, into Kym's eyes. Awkward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe I'm seeing you again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (more uncomfortable) I know. It's so weird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen. Do you remember that exercise where we all had to write down experiences and pass them anonymously to another person?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "The Human Mirror: Seeing With a Fresh Perspective" Like Secret Santas of despair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym gives him a quizzical look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You drew poodles in the margins. I know it's supposed to be anonymous and everything, but you were so brave. The way your uncle abused you and your sister, and how it led to your sister's anorexia, and how you stayed up nights when she was down to fifty pounds holding a mirror to her face to make sure she was breathing. I'll never forget reading that, I swear to God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel's stylist is removing her foils while Rachel choke her Diet Pepsi and it comes out her nose. Kym looks nervo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Rachel) Do you want a tissue?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel looks horrified, holding her hand over her nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Kym) I found it so profoundly inspirational that you could be there for her during your own incredible ordeal. I thank God that you came in here today. I never thought I'd ever have the chance to thank you. It was your strength that gave me the courage to confront my own abuse and help me turn my life around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel slams down her magazine and leaves the salon. Kym after her. Both girls have foils in their hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel is being trailed by her sister through the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KYM Would you stop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel doesn't stop. She is searching for her keys in the fading daylight. Kym catches up, takes Rachel's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL Don't touch me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KYM Don't you think his perspective might be a little skewed? RACHEL I never had anorexia. You sure as hell didn't watch over me while I was sleeping and WE DON'T HAVE A

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KYM (interrupting) --That we know of!-- RACHEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHIT IN ONE FELL SWOOP!...Did you tell them that Dad forced us into a life of prostitution while you were at it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KYM Ew!... (she stops and tries to remember) Wait...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel yanks open the car door, jumps in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KYM I wasn't hurting anybody. No one got hurt, Rach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel slams the car door shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm hurt!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel drives off with a screech, leaving her sister stan there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel, yanking the foils out of her hair, perches on the sofa next to Carol and Paul. She is furious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't hate her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me what I don't hate. I hate, hate the lies. She lied in rehab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean she lied?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lied to the people who were working with her. Who were trying to help her. She lies to everybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not getting it) Where is she now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where am I now, Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel! Rachel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank god. In here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym comes stomping in. Her foils are still intact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for abandoning me. I had to take a taxi!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disbelieving) Are you kidding me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would anything I said or didn't say at the hospital hurt you? It wasn't about you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? Why wasn't it about me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, stop. (to Kym) Why not? I was hopeful. I was on your side. I still am. Do you have any idea what that means? Do you have any idea how lonely it was with everybody gone into your terrible world? There was nothing left. Everybody was just empty. You think they remembered I was alive or needed anything during your... life? And after all that loneliness and Mom and Dad blaming each other and worrying and death and divorce and that stupid hopefulness and Dad not even being able to listen to music, you were in the hospital, lying about us! Instead of telling the truth about yourself!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, Rachel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. Wait a minute. What's this all about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apparently she has a whole history of sexual molestation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym, what is your sister saying? Did you say you were sexually molested?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Jesus Christ. Not by you! It was a long time ago!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why in god's name would you say something like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was anonymous! It seemed like a good idea at the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three on the couch are stunned for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, look at me. I'm right here. I'm telling you that after Ethan died I wanted her to get better or just die...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And look! She is better!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice, Rachel. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Paul) ...And Dad, she was lying and she didn't give a shit about the rest of us. Recovery can't work if you lie. She knows that. I was worthless to her. We all meant nothing to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not worthless. You're my sister. I love you guys. I need you guys, but you don't get to sit around for the rest of my life deciding what I'm supposed to be like. You weren't there. You weren't inside my head when I was fucked up and your certainly not there now. You haven't got a clue what I feel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym, you took Ethan for granted. You were high for his life. You were not present for his life. You were high. He was like a pet to you. You drove him off the bridge. And now he's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was an accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! I was stoned out of my mind! Jesus Christ, who do I have to be now? Mother Theresa? Did I use up all the love I'm allowed for this lifetime because I killed our little brother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it was an accident!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry! I'm sorry, okay? I'm sorry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul bursts out weeping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was an accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym, her hair still in foils, rushes out of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol turns to Rachel. Rachel bolts upstairs. Carol turns Paul. Paul waves her away. Carol is bawling too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A STATE TROOPER, sitting in his patrol car, looks up from coffee as Paul's Mercedes station wagon screeches into a nearby parking space. The cop watches Kym get out of the and stalk into the 7/11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steam rises from the surface of Abby's high-tech and sumptuous bathtub, as she quickly turns the water off and speaks into her cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABBY Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is alone and the door is shut

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAUL Hello Abby. It's Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INTERCUT the conversation:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABBY Hello Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAUL Is Kym with you? ABBY No. Why? Did she go somewhere? PAUL She left the house about an hour ago. ABBY To a meeting? PAUL She and Rachel had an argument. ABBY Oh, dear. The night before her wedding? What was it about? PAUL Look, Abby, it doesn't matter. She left the house. She took the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABBY What was the argument about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAUL I don't know. They were both getting their hair done...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know? Well what were they saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For god's sake Abby! I'm trying to figure out where she went before I call the police!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, last time you called the police looking for her she was upstairs, asleep in the guest room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wasn't asleep, she was unconscious! And I'm glad I called the police because it took twenty minutes to wake her up and at least something was being done!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, I'm trying to help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're trying to dismiss everything!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not a criminal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're disregarding everything I'm saying, and this failure to listen, failure to understand what is right in front of you is exactly why you will never be able...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...To help her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe that's not what she needs all the time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incredulous) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stammering) I mean..I mean maybe she needs us --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Maybe she needs someone to be watchful and present and in her life!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- To trust her --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She could hurt herself! She could be lying dead in a ditch somewhere!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right! All right! Stop it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. Paul tries to pull himself together. Abby is trembl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you hear anything, can I count on you to please call me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incredulous) Can you count on me?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby puts her hand to her mouth. INTERCUT with Paul waiti then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes Paul, you can count on me to call if I hear anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Abby waits: then

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is piled high with boxes overflowing with tulle flowers and glassware. Carol, Sidney, Rachel, Kieran and are seated around the cheerless dining room table, pickin the dinner in front of them...even Emma appears to have g up. She is drinking a lot of wine. Paul returns to the ta

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAUL Abby hasn't heard from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel stabs her dessert with her fork. Her head is on Sidney's shoulder, she looks pale and exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAROL She must feel awful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KIERAN (gently) Excuse me, but when you're trying to get better there's a lot of pressure in rehabs... when someone isn't ready to take responsibility they create something, like an Uncle Stan, to take responsibility until they're ready. PAUL (hollow) Well, she's always been creative. CAROL I just wish we knew where she was. SIDNEY Paul, Would you like me to go out and look for her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel takes Sidney's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAROL You're getting married tomorrow. A hundred people will be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KIERAN I'll go. I'm...I'll go. Any idea where she might have gone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody looks at Kieran. No one responds. The phone rin Carol goes to get it. Everybody waits. CAROL It's the caterer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma gives Rachel's arm a squeeze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kieran, looking drawn under the fluorescent lights, stand inside the Jamaican restaurant staring out at the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THROUGH THE WINDOW a beat up WHITE HONDA tears ass right through the stop sign and screeches on up the road. Kiera flinches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby is in her kitchen preparing tea, dressed in loose- fitting yoga-style PJs, hair still wet from her bath. A d opens behind her and Kym emerges from the bathroom rubbin her hands over her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhh....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should call your father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The air seems to go out of Kym for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a minute. I need a glass of water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've made some tea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby picks up the tray, leading the way from the kitchen the living room. Trailing behind her, Kym looks around he mother's unfamiliar house -- the spaciousness and stark modernity of Andrew's house stand in marked contrast to t rampant folksy-ness of the Buchman house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby places the tea service on a low table in front of a sprawling sofa in the stone-walled living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here darling. Sit down. You look upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym sits, pours and sips. Abby remains standing and tight the belt of her bathrobe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When will Andrew be back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not too late. He's at a dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I spoke to grandma today. She sends her love. Is everything all right with the wedding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad was loading the dishwasher...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm hmmm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I handed him Ethan's bowl with the trains on it by accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym begins to weep. Abby remains still. Kym's weeping bec louder and louder. She is having trouble breathing. Just as Abby reaches out to touch her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you leave me in charge of him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You knew. All of you knew. People told you. I was a junkie.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: KYM (cont'd) I was a crazy drug addict. I stole from you. I lied to your face. I weighed six pounds and my hair was falling out. I spent every dinner in the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I was. It's not like there weren't any clues. I stayed in my room for days. I passed out all the time. Where were you, Mom! What were you thinking? Why did you leave me? Why did you leave me in charge of him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby closes her fists and beats Kym with all her strength

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You weren't supposed to kill him! You weren't supposed to kill him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym curls up protectively and Abby suddenly stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby swings at Kym again and connects. Kym punches Abby right back -- twice -- now she is on her feet. Both women stop, terrified, and look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym moves toward her mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym stops. Keeping her back to the door she backs out of mother's house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym falls down the front steps. Her nose is bleeding and eye starts to swell. Where are the car keys? Here they ar Where is the door handle? Here it is. She drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym driving the station wagon too fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --KYM'S P.O.V.: THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD-- Headlights. Windshield wipers. It's not raining. A curve in the road, squealing around it. The road forks twenty yards ahead, w in between. Left or right? Kym drives straight ahead, careening off the road, smashing down a couple of sapling losing speed, right fender smashing into a big rock -- AIRBAGS blast up into Kym's face -- airbag deflates, Kym' head falls forward, bangs against the steering wheel. A t moan. That's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The station wagon has come to a halt far off the road, concealed by undergrowth and trees in the foreground. The is no movement in the car. A Volvo station wagon drives b continuing on its way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, Kieran, and Sidney are seated around the family roo Paul and Sidney are drinking red wine, Kieran something e An empty bottle is in front of them and Sidney is uncorki fresh one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAUL ...I never thought I'd have two little girls. Two little girls running around with their tummies sticking out in their diapers. They used to bite me on the nose, the two of them. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: PAUL (cont'd) I'd hold both of them in the pool and they'd take turns biting my nose. Ethan never did that. He preferred pinkies. Or knuckles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney and Kieran chuckle appreciatively. Paul joins the laughter, pours some more wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel and Emma are curled up in the middle of the bed, s style, with clothes still on. Emma is behind Rachel, lost the world, gently snoring. Rachel's eyes are wide open. Carol swings the door cautiously open and peers inside. Rachel and Carol look at each other for a long time. Caro withdraws, closing the door behind her.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. FORK IN THE ROAD. DAWN.
dialogues.text: The station wagon seen just as before. A couple of jogger lope by on the road.

dialogues.speaker: EXT/INT. STATION WAGON. MORNING.
dialogues.text: Kym jolts awake as a STAMFORD POLICEMAN raps on her close window. She is a mess. A black eye. A split, bloody lip. gash across her forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cop is simultaneously gesturing for her to roll her window down and speaking into his radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym tries to start the car. No luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cop bangs on the window. Kym leans her head against the steering wheel. The horn starts blowing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The joggers, a couple of early dogwalkers, and a couple o kids on bikes are gathered by the roadside, whispering an watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NOW -- The cop is studying Kym's license and registration NOW -- An AMBULANCE has arrived. Red lights flashing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd of onlookers has swelled considerably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NOW -- The cop gives a clearly upset Kym a Breathalyzer t as PARAMEDICS wrap a pressure cuff around her arm -- she exhales into the Breathalyzer tube, her eyes darting betw the cop, the cracked windshield of the car and the gawkin crowd up on the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIME CUT -- The paramedic holds Kym firmly by the chin and peers deeply into her right eye. The other paramedic blots at Kym's swollen lip with a gauze and hands her an pack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIME CUT -- The cop gives Kym her license and hands her an official looking form, which she stuffs in her shoulde bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A truck towing the beat-up station wagon comes to a halt the street in front of the Buchman house. Kym steps down the passenger seat, ignoring whatever the driver just sai parting. The house is festooned with peonies and lights and WORKER hurrying about. Everything looks absolutely beautiful. CATERERS are running from their vans into the house with armloads of food, drinks, etc. Abby's flowers are being unloaded from another van. Decorative chandeliers are bei carried inside. VALETS are setting up their car-parking operation (a decorated picnic table) at the foot of the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym squares her shoulders and begins her long walk up to Buchman house, back into the chaos. A CUTE VALET passes Kym on the lawn, carrying two paper c of coffee, dressed in an Indian military tunic. He takes Kym's disheveled and bruised appearance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VALET Um. Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KYM I'm the Maid of Honor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym continues her walk toward the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I know you. I used to work at the dog grooming place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym keeps walking, ignoring him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you holding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul and Carol, beautifully dressed, appear on the front porch and hurry towards Kym.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kymmie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my lord...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They meet at the circular driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hit Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god is she...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not with the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to get you to a hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to get dressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at you! You need to get to a hospital!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad! I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tries to touch her. She stops his hand. Paul backs off

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't just vanish. You can't just leave. You have to call. You always have to call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul looks helplessly at his wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you go find your sister? She didn't sleep last night waiting for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym runs onto the porch as a group of GOFERS carry more o Abby's flowers through the front door. Emma is on the front porch filling balloons with helium, assisted by the kids from next door. Emma inhales from a balloon as she sees Kym.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a helium voice)                                 Oh. My. God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kieran is in the living room on his cell phone when he sp Kym. Behind him we see Norman Sklear, Matt and Innbo remo the last of the living room furniture to the rear patio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit. (into the phone) She just showed up. Yes. Thank you. (to Kym) Do you need a doctor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sent out the cavalry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For your dad. Mostly for your dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to get ready. I have to get dressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I'm so glad to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KYM'S P.O.V. -- charging up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Also known as the bridal chamber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym yanks the door open and Rachel jumps a mile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaaah! Fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is dressed in her Sari and huge gold earrings and loo beautiful, despite a lack of sleep. Seeing her bashed up sister framed in the doorway, Rachel fights tears. She loses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hit Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hit Mom? You hit our mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym looks completely desperate. She nods. Rachel's face contorts with rage as she steps forward and slams the bed door in Kym's face. Kym winces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel yanks the door open again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel has run a bath for her sister. She has removed her sari but not her earrings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym is in the bath. Her body is bruised and purple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel dabs gently at Kym's face with a washcloth while K scrubs at her nails with a brush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She glides the soapy washcloth over Kym's back. She notic the word ethan inscribed within the design of the rose an thorns image tattooed on Kym's left shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel rinses shampoo and leaves and dirt out of her sist hair while Kym brushes her teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel dabs makeup on Kym's chin as Kym's hands tremble w the mascara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back in her wedding Sari, Rachel wraps Kym in her bridesmaid's gown and puts some Lilies of the Valley in h hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you do this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CEREMONY -- Guests, some standing, some in white chai The living room is festooned with wall to wall flowers. A canopy of cherry blossoms leads from the living room terr to the opened living room doors. Sidney, looking stunning a dove grey Nehru suit and a lavender pocket square, wait the altar with groomsmen Kieran, Norman Sklear, and Cousi Joseph (now wearing full dress U.S. Army uniform)... and officiating JUDGE CASTLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SFX: LIVE MUSIC -- "Here Comes The Bride" on distant elec guitar and drums plus foreground violin and gently chante "Rachel's" and "Sidney's" by the assembled friends. Emma's smiling face fills the frame as the ceremony begin Bridesmaids Emma, Kayra Williams, Victoria, and - -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym in her dress with her striped hair, split lip and bla eye, trying to find her game face. The wedding guests are slack-jawed. Mrs. Williams (Sidney's mom) looks like she' passing a stone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby stands quietly with Andrew in the first row. She loo composed and lovely and has the tiniest hint of a bruise her chin. The procession reaches the altar and the wedding party tu to face Rachel and Paul. Paul is beaming, walking his beautiful daughter from the of the house and across the terrace to the living room. S glows in her white and gold Sari.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They reach the altar of blossoms. Rachel kisses her dad's cheek and he hugs her. Things are set up so that Rachel a Sidney stand just inside the living room, facing the beautiful backyard. Kym reaches for Rachel's bouquet but Rachel has handed it Emma by reflex. Kym tries to cover her gesture. Rachel and Sidney join hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're here on this beautiful day...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody's baby starts to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody cracks up, especially Kym. She laughs a beat lo than anybody else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mumbling) Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel and Sidney are saying their vows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always just wanted to hear music, and when I met you I heard you. You are the most beautiful thing I've ever heard. Thanks for marrying me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel is crying. Sidney takes his pocket square and carefully dries her tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby is drying her own eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel makes her own declaration to Sidney. Norman Sklear hands Sidney an acoustic guitar and Sidney strums it and plucks a delicate melody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For you. (to Rachel's stomach) And you...ahem... (sings)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "She used to work in a diner Never saw a woman look finer I used to order just to watch her float across the floor She grew up in a small town Never put her roots down Daddy always kept movin', so she did too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know it ain't easy You got to hold on                                    She was an unknown legend                             in her time                                           Now she's dressin' two kids                           Lookin' for a magic kiss                              She gets the far-away look                            in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somewhere on a desert highway                         She rides a Harley-Davidson                           Her long blonde hair                                  flyin' in the wind                                    She's been runnin' half her life                      The chrome and steel she rides                        Collidin' with the very                               air she breathes                                      The air she breathes.                                 The air she breathes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guests join in on the last chorus, with spontaneous a lib instrumentation from some of the musician friends. Th song ends with a huge eruption of laughter and applause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On that note, and with the power                      vested in me by the state of Connecticut and Neil Young, I now                     pronounce you husband and wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Kiss! Lots of screaming and laughing. Huge applause. Carol and Mr. Williams throw pink and white confetti hear

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym applauds wildly and is crying her eyes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul weeps openly. Carol breathes a sigh of relief.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. BUCHMAN BACKYARD. LATER.
dialogues.text: POST-CEREMONY LUNCH -- the whole Wedding Party Inner Circ everybody, is enjoying barbecue, oysters, Vegetarian Supr beers, wine, various other chill-juices and snackettes -- the back terrace, around the swimming pool and spread out picnic tables and blankets across the expansive back lawn The exotic reception party tent stands proudly and inviti down the slope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE MUSICIAN FRIENDS are playing their version of "Rachel Loves Sidney." Some guests have removed as many layers of clothing as weather permits. Some -- including Sidney and Rachel -- have even changed into Bermudas and sweatshirts the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel and Sidney are serving second helpings to their friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby and Andrew are at a table eating and chatting with t Chicago Cousins, the Rosenzweigs, and Cookie Puss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym is tying a LITTLE BOY'S balloon to his wrist. She loo over at her mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby is deep in conversation with Andrew. She tucks a str hair behind his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel and Sidney are cutting the cake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this mocha? Or chocolate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He samples the frosting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby Boy, let them take the picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Baby Boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel licks the frosting off Sidney's finger then gives mom a big wholesome smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Williams shakes her head but she's okay with this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we all do this together?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reshuffling as Sidney, his parents, Kayra, and Rachel, Pa Carol and Kym each place a hand on the silver cake knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With nowhere else to stand, Abby lays her fingers lightly Kym's wrist. Emma's AUNT JOYCE, a cool professional photo SNAPS THE PICTURE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear God, bless this family and let them always invite us for dinner because my new wife can't boil water or fry an egg. La Chaim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: La Chaim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel suddenly stands on a chair and bangs on a glass wi spoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Friends and family, family and friends! I have an announcement to make! I'm the bride and I'm knocked up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surprised whooping and hollering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm exercising my bridely, knocked up prerogatives and demand that

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: everybody starts dancing. And this means you too, Mom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby smiles. SFX: The Deejay spins an infectious platter (TBD).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yay! Dad c'mon. C'mon Dad! This is my favorite song!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooo. Look at me, I'm dancing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She drags Paul to the temporary poolside patio dance floo Paul is a fantastic dancer! Sidney drags his dad to the d floor. He's dramatic and weird! Abby smiles politely at K and goes to sit down with Andrew. Kieran spirits Kym to t patio, where they join the dancers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE RECEIVING LINE -- All members of both families are li

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: up outside the entrance to the tent to greet the INNER CI GANG and the LUCKY FEW OUTSIDERS who have been invited to this evening's gala wedding reception party. It is twilig

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody is spruced and rested. Rachel and Sidney have changed into awesome party outfits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the tent, yet another group of musician friends ar currently laying down an evocative, hypnotic and extremel cool, jazzy "world music" groove as the same attractive a immaculate young servers (from the rehearsal dinner) circulate with trays of delicious appetizers, wine, seltz etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym is still wearing her sari. She stands next to her mot They are doing their wedding party duties. Neither woman looking at the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Abby indicating Kym) And how is our little wayward girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. (Beat.) I had an accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, how are you, Bob?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, never better -- Isaac opened his practice!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're all so glad you made it! I shouldn't be telling you this, but there was actually a pool! Is that hysterical?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyeing Kym's injuries with a twinkle) If you're in need of any legal services...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know if you remember this but you owe me $750.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you holding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym? Do you remember me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry...I'm not sure...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym! Angela Paylin!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angela sports an intense tattooed image on the inside of right forearm. Her face features a unique piercing. Kym h her. Their reunion makes her cry...Angela is nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tent is fairly packed now with about 60-SOME ODD PEOP Everybody is getting along fine. With a single dramatic gesture, Norman Sklear silences the band. Upon Norman's instructions, the drummer works his cymbals in such a way that the party-goers realize that something big is about happen. Norman Sklear now gestures for complete silence a he gets it. Rachel and Emma grin madly at each other.

dialogues.speaker: SFX
dialogues.text: LOUDER approaching the tent entrance from the moonlit backyard. ALL EYES ON THE ENTRANCE -- the swimming pool lights shimmering outside as --

dialogues.speaker: CARNIVAL GIRLS COMPLETE WITH HEADDRESSES AND FEATHERS DAN
dialogues.text: INTO THE MIDDLE OF THE CROWD! The musicians blow whistles bang on drums. The cafe-au-lait beauties gyrate and pull guests out of their chairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel leaps from her chair into Sidney's arms and he giv her a huge, sexy kiss as he rubs her tummy. Wedding guest scream with delight and rush to the floor. The drummers become more   impassioned with every beat. T travel allover the dance   floor, a trail of guests behin them. Sweat is dripping,   the girls are glistening wet, guests are pulled into a   massive pulsing heartbeat on t dance floor. Emma, Kayra and Victoria are dancing together screaming u Cousin Joseph, Matt and another male friend muscle their in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little kids swing each other around in circles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel and Sidney are practically doing it on the dance floor. A Brazilian beauty shimmies over to them, her headdress bobbing, her smile enormous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney immediately puts his head on her bosom. After a be Rachel does too, laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol stands quietly besides Paul and takes his hand and whispers to him. Though not dancing, they are clearly enjoying the carnival. Paul gives a little shimmy. Abby and Andrew are huddled together at a table, talking intensely. It's like they are blind to the spectacle. Kieran offers his hand to Kym. She leaps up, spilling her flowers. Kieran pulls her to the middle of the crowd. The circle each other. They come together almost violently an dance like there's no tomorrow. Kym's head is thrown back Shoulders heaving, Kieran swings her around by the waist. SFX: DRUMMERS DRIVING THE PARTY FASTER AND FASTER. Emma shimmies wildly with her partner, her hair a mess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. and Mrs. Williams clapping wildly and doing the limbo/hustle/drunken parent dance. Guests stomping and cheering. The brown, glittering dancers are shaking thisclose to th drummers who have their shirts off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dancer rocks with an older gentleman who gulps oxygen f a tank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel and Sidney are bathed in sweat, kissing. Sidney is gulping champagne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kieran and Kym have their foreheads together and their ey closed, chests heaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol and Paul watching, laughing. Andrew whispering in Abby's ear. She just stares off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kieran and Kym glued together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel tossing her hair wildly, Sidney behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone laughing, laughing, dancing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The exotic tent looks beautiful out there in the sprawlin backyard, reflections of the POOL LIGHTS shimmering off i sides. The whole backyard is enchanted -- with magically deployed twinkle lights, Japanese lanterns and other spec lighting effects adding to the aura...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Rachel Loves Sidney" is being played in a mellow, super- romantic trumpet solo mode now by Christian Scott.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An assorted bunch of guests have relocated to the poolsid patio in their finery. The oxygen guy and his matronly wi are seated on a transplanted living room couch, talking intently to a be-feathered headdressed Dancer. Norman Sklear and Emma are sharing a stylish, quietly triumphant slow dance, whispering punctuated by gusts of laughter. Angela Paylin is out there too. Little kids are running around the lawn and a few are pla with OLIVE the Dog. Kym kneels at the far corner of the swimming pool, unnoti by anyone. A wooden serving tray floats on the surface of water, supporting a candle wrapped in rice paper. A coupl smaller candles surround the slightly larger one. Kym lig the candles, extinguishes the match, gently slides the illuminated tray out towards the center of the pool, watc Kym rises and walks towards the house, looking for someth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kym) I can do a handstand!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She executes a truly terrible handstand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sucked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl throws a rebellious dance move in Kym's directio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ouch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl laughs and runs off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym crosses the back terrace and enters the living room through the flower bedecked canopy....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: where she finds Rachel and Sidney slow dancing alone and dreamy in the center of the darkened room, the walls stil covered with the ceremonial flowers. A single candle flic nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dancers are oblivious to Kym's presence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Rachel) Hi. Where's Mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel has her head on Sidney's shoulder, her eyes closed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taking a break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you take a break from your own daughter's wedding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom doesn't actually participate in things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And anyway, she hasn't even done anything all day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was thinking about getting her a cat. Cats are really annoying. At some point you have to deal with them, right? Or they starve to death and piss on your sheets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's so nice here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Kieran sweeps into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can run but you can't hide!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym shrieks as Kieran grabs her and plants a wet one on h dipping her to the floor. They careen into Sidney and Rac Sidney grabs Rachel and starts molesting her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (totally into it) Stop! Stop you fiend!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel and Sidney fall to the floor writhing, sounding wa too amorous. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ceiling light flicks on overhead and Abby enters the living room. Blinking against the light, Rachel struggles her feet smoothing her dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from the floor) Hello Abby. You're lovely. And I'm not looking up your skirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kieran is busting a gut not to laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been looking for you all over the place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby? Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrew pops his head in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're bringing the car around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're leaving?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darling, I'm exhausted. I had such a marvelous time. Those dancers were so beautiful. But weddings are really for young people.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ABBY (cont'd) I thought we'd just sneak off and not make a big scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could make a little scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And here I am making it. Andrew and I are going to Washington in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you going to Washington?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the mother of all fund raisers at American. I thought I mentioned it. We're going to stay on about a week - there are lots of meetings. I thought since you two are going away soon... (to Kym) ...and I'm sure you don't want any grown ups around checking up on you...Will you still be here when I get back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym doesn't say anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about our post-nuptial wedding gossip reconnaissance, Mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, can you come by early?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course you don't want to do that. It's your wedding night. You don't want to get up early. I have to get Andrew organized. He's hopeless. And we'll be back in a bit. It was such a lovely wedding, darling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She bends in for a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! I want my mother and my sister!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel wraps one arm around Kym's neck and the other roun her mother and hugs them both to her. She has her eyes op

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have their eyes open. They are stiff as boards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel stops hugging and looks from one to the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her mom and sister look at her and each other. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you call me every day about...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pats Rachel's tummy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye Abby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good bye, Son-in-law.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym and Rachel watch their mother leave the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (horrified) I saw your mother's underwear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym sees Abby and Andrew crossing the front porch through window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't find my cigarettes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym moves quickly from the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym is heading for the front door, when Paul breaks away a group of guests having coffee in the dining room and na her, pulling her into a conversation with a WEDDING GUEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kymmie. Speak of the devil. You remember Susanna Galeano.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (she doesn't) Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Kym.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym is looking out the dining room window between Paul an Susanna -- she spots Abby and Andrew walking down the driveway towards the VALETS at the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susanna has a public relations firm and she just lost one of her assistants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weddings. They're an epidemic. Your father gave me my start about a hundred years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no. Hardly. Well...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could definitely use an extra body right about now. Have you ever thought about Public Relations?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The public is kind of afraid of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susanna and Paul laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The firm is opening an office right here in town, just in time for the holidays. You could stay right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever thought about P.R. Kym?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logistically it's just a dream. You could stay in your old room. I could chauffeur you around. You wouldn't have to worry about rent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you already talked to Carol about me staying here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. She's fine about it. You could stay in your old room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you give me a call on Monday, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands Kym a business card and kisses Paul on the chee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye Paul. It was just beautiful. Bye Kym.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzy's first rate. P.R. can be fascinating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You always said it was stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I meant stupid. Do you want me to hold that for you? You've got no pockets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got it. Thanks, Dad. I'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the edge of the porch Kym sees Abby standing in the moonlight at the front of the driveway with Andrew, waiti for their car. Kym pauses. Abby turns her head slightly in Kym's direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym, in the half dark, watches her mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby does not move a muscle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym steps off the porch. The valet pulls up in the car, jumps out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby fixes her gaze on Andrew as he opens the door for he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They drive off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Absolute End of a Wedding. The place is a gorgeous me of wedding detritus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tent looks so lonely. A weary caterer packs away his trays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kieran is talking and smoking with Sidney at the end of t lawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A freshly scrubbed Kym, in her own clothes, takes a momen Ethan's room. She collects a few snapshots of her sister brother and stuffs them in her shoulder bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Kym approaches the stairs, Emma staggers into the hall bleary-eyed. She is in her underwear, heading for the bathroom. She stops at the sight of Kym. They stare at ea other. Emma gives a tiny wave. Kym responds, heads down t stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym slipping quietly downstairs. She moves to collect her weird mish-mash of bags waiting by the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kieran is there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oof. You scared me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Making a break for it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I have to go. I was coming to find you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to slip away without making any noise, you know? I like noise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was coming to find you. My ride's outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Okay...If you need anything...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I need to post bond?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kieran hands Kym a folded piece of paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. If you ever need anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Kieran.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you'll come visit me in Hawaii?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That would be nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles, kisses her, tenderly. She hugs him fiercely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go. Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym looks back in through the window, sees her father awa in his robe, tired, gamely tidying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unbelievably softly and tenderly) Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol comes up behind Paul, envelopes him in a gentle bea hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A `98 maroon CAMRY is idling in the circular driveway out front, exhaust vaporizing against the chilly morning air. cute two-year-old girl is visible in a carseat and Rosa, staff nurse from Kym's halfway house, is at the wheel. Th car radio plays quietly as Kym opens the passenger door, wiggling her finger at the little girl. Like a ghost, Rachel appears on the porch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kym jumps a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sisters lock eyes. Kym looks pained. Paul is still moving around in there. S wants to go. Rachel floats down the porch stairs and joins her sister the car. She takes in Rosa who meets Rachel's look with a nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KYM (whispering) Will you tell Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel nods. Kym is crying. KYM I love your baby!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel hugs her sister fiercely. Kym gets into the passenger seat but leaves the car door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel smiles her huge, luminous smile. Kym shuts the car door and rolls down the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Bye!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel mouths "Bye" and gives a little wave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car pulls out of the driveway, Carol watching it go f the dining room window.
